definition: done or happening a little at a time
example: A piecemeal approach to dealing with the problem
Don't forget to shut the cat out when you leave for work.

definition: to expect that something will happen
example: We had some difficulties along the way that we didn't anticipate.

definition: a feeling of being close to somebudy because you have similar origins or attitudes.
example: He felt a real sense of kinshipwith his fellow soldiers.

definition: 1. full of life and energy (exciting) 2.(of colours) very bright and strong
example: A vibrant city. The room was decorated in vibrant reds and yellows.

definition: behaving in a pleasant, polite, calm way
example: He was gracious enough to thank me.

definition: 1. pleasant and kind. not causing damage or harm 2. (of tumours) not dangerous. (OPPOSITE - malignant)
example: A benign old lady. She is recovering after surgery to remove a benign tumour.

definition: showing that you are happy and confident
example: He scampered jauntily down the stairs.

definition: mix, move, to make somebody excited
example: Stir the sauce gently until it begins to boil. She was stirred by his sad story.

definition: to take a short, quick breath through the mouth, especially because off surprise, pain orr shock.
a feeling of great respect sometimes mixed with fear or surprise.
example: As children, we were rather in awe of our grandfather.

definition: serious and without any humor. (OPPOSITE - cheerful)
a young child, especially one who is learning or has recently learned to walk.
example: Are these toys suitable for toddlers?

definition: to think or talk a lot about something, especially something it would be better to forget.
example: So you made a mistake, but there is no need to dwell on it.

definition: a gradual increase in loudness, or the moment when noise or piece of music is at its loudest.
Hasty actions are done in a hurry, sometimes without the necessary care or thought
example: He warned against making hasty decisions.
